page.title: 04PORTWAY JUNIOR SCHOOL CONT
page.content: cover was bought with P.T.A.money. Nowadays food is dehydrated and frozen because there is not enough staff to make fresh meals. Miss Marshall was appointed as Cook-Supervisor but in the same year(l952) Mrs. G. Holt took over. She remained Cook-Supervisor until l980 when Mrs. M. Owen took over. The first freezer was installed into the kitchen in l980. The caretakers of Portway were Mr. Goddup, Mr. Hughes and Mr. Allingham. Portway County Infant School became Portway Junior School when Portway Infant School opened on 9th January l962.
